author: nero_eth
content:
I would like to hear opinions on this PR to the EIP:
https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/10634#issuecomment-3458463929

It proposes to:
addresses: bytes -> bytes20
storage keys: bytes -> uint256
storage values: bytes -> uint256

The first is more a clarification. In the specs, we already use bytes20, iirc.
For storage keys and values, we'd only have it uint256 in the bal, not like internally.

Also, just to double-check, clients use uint256 for balances, and not uint128?

<@427903869226582018> <@680337202521440470> <@429719902363058177> <@465903001156976682> <@348512261955911691>
